detailed_goals: Continue identifying specific EHR data elements required for seasonal influenza trend analysis.
Refine data collection workflow based on initial feedback and identified data gaps.
Review EHR system capabilities for influenza data collection.
Communicate hospital's specific requirements to the EHR vendor.
Finalize modifications to clinical workflows for influenza data capture.
Collaborate with clinical staff to integrate new data collection steps.
Implement data quality checks for influenza-related data.
Conduct initial audits to identify and address data inaccuracies.
Accurately enter patient data into the EHR, including symptoms and vaccination status.
Participate in training on new EHR functionalities for influenza tracking.
Develop and configure necessary EHR system updates for influenza data collection.
Begin testing new EHR functionalities.
Monitor project progress and address any emerging issues.
Communicate updates to all stakeholders.
Finalize database schema for seasonal influenza data.
Implement data type and constraint definitions to ensure data integrity.
Define initial data quality metrics for EHR data related to influenza.
Set weekly targets for data quality improvement.
Develop training modules for new influenza data collection procedures.
Conduct initial training sessions for nursing staff.
Validate data consistency across different data sources.
Implement automated validation rules within the EHR system.
Administer influenza vaccinations and document details in the EHR.
Educate patients on influenza prevention and treatment.
Collaborate with the EHR vendor to implement system modifications.
Test new EHR functionalities for influenza data collection.
Monitor patients for adverse reactions to antiviral medications.
Document patient education in the EHR.
Address user concerns related to EHR system and data collection.
Document and escalate complex technical issues as needed.
Develop a plan for resolving data quality issues related to influenza.
Conduct root cause analysis for identified data quality issues.
Begin abstracting historical influenza data into the EHR system.
Follow standardized data abstraction protocols.
Gather feedback from clinical staff on EHR system and workflows.
Advocate for clinician needs in the EHR implementation project.
Abstract data from the most recent influenza season.
Ensure accuracy and completeness of abstracted data.
Collaborate on resolving data quality issues related to influenza.
Implement corrective actions based on root cause analysis.
